p: A high percentage of buildings are vulnerable to climatic conditions, mainly to the temperature changes depending on the time of the day [ 21]. These hourly changes influence the relationship between the occupants' comfort and their health [ 22], mainly with those who spend their indoor time mainly at night between 11 PM and 5 AM in bad conditions [ 23], or among those who maintain thermal comfort during the day, as in residences [ 24]. In consequence, the interior environment of a house is one of the aspects that can be improved with adequate environmental policies and regulations. Examples such as the correct application of the best construction practices are key to “… better understanding of the interactions between specific housing and building conditions with physical and mental health outcomes” [ 25].
